sQuestion: About 4.9 million households had one brand of personal computers in 2001. The use of these computers grew at an average rate of 0.275 million households a year. In 2001 , about 2.5 millions households used another type of computer. The use of these computers grew at an average rate of 0.7 million households a year. How long will it take for the two types of computers to be in the same number of households?

sentences.sentence: About 4.9 million households had one brand of personal computers in 2001.
The use of these computers grew at an average rate of 0.275 million households a year.
In 2001 , about 2.5 millions households used another type of computer.
The use of these computers grew at an average rate of 0.7 million households a year.
How long will it take for the two types of computers to be in the same number of households?
